abstracts.cdata!:
The note expands on the partial credit
            guarantee for the US$100 million bond issue, which helped
            mobilize the necessary financing to fund the financing gap
            for the Lebanon Power Sector Restructuring project. The
            guarantee was successful in catalyzing private financing for
            the power sector from the capital markets. Electricite du
            Liban (EDL) is in the process of recovering from 17 years of
            damage caused by the civil war. It would have been difficult
            for EDL to access the commercial capital markets under its
            own name. Therefore, while EDL is undergoing restructuring,
            and sector reforms are in progress, the Government of
            Lebanon has borrowed on behalf of EDL in order to maximize
            the terms of the borrowing sought under the partial credit
            guarantee. The extended maturity, the diversified investor
            base, and the tightened spread, all achieved with the help
            of the World Bank guarantee, should help to act as a
            catalyst for future investments in Lebanon.
